--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2023/0355 b) Date of Occurrence: 29/09/2024
c) Installation Details: Albatross Transport - AC-3765-257
at Maintenance Hub-X
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 08/10/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Compressor Section d) Main Assembly: Pylon-D
e) Nomenclature: Compressor Section Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-A
g) Part No.: PR-7864-X3 h) Sl No.: SN-8429-687
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 02/02/2020 l) Date of Removal: 06/10/2024
Pg No: 62 Ln No: 3 Pg No: 65 Ln No: 10
m) Manufacturing Agency: Elite Aerospace Solutions n) Date, Month & Year January 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2503 Hrs / 1592 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Engine vibration level increase. Malfunction reported by flight crew.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Compressor Section component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct non-destructive testing to verify structural integrity
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions.
Date: 22/10/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. A.K. Sharma

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 24/10/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection.
Date: 23/10/2024 Signature: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality aspects from regulatory perspective reviewed. Investigation methodology is comprehensive and acceptable.
Date: 25/10/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 27/10/2024 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
